response_parsed.title: Property Testing Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to effectively perform property-based testing on event-driven systems implemented using FastAPI in Python 3.12+. It covers setting up the testing environment, writing tests with Hypothesis, and optimizing for performance.
key_points: Define custom strategies to generate input data
Decorate FastAPI routes with `@pytest.mark.integration` or `@pytest.mark.unit` for integration and unit tests respectively
Use pytest fixtures for managing test dependencies
Optimize tests with Hypothesis strategies to reduce test execution time
version_notes: FastAPI 0.71.0 or later is required for Python 3.12+ support
Hypothesis 6.58.4 or later is compatible with FastAPI 0.71.0
caveats: Ensure that the Hypothesis strategies generate meaningful and realistic test data to avoid false positives and negatives
Avoid using `@pytest.mark.integration` for unit tests as it may include dependencies that are not necessary
Optimize tests by defining specific strategies that target potential issues in the event-driven system
